com.apple.audio.util
Class HostTime

java.lang.Object
  com.apple.audio.util.HostTime
public final class HostTime
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains methods to deal with the time services and conversion methods.

The long values that are taken or returned by these calls are unsigned values in their native representation. Thus any negative values will be interpreted as very large long numbers. The facilities of the BigDecimal class can be used to determine their unsigned value if required.

Method Summary
static long convertHostTimeToNanos(long inHostTime)
          Convert the given host time to a time in Nanoseconds.
static long convertNanosToHostTime(long inNanos)
          Convert the given Nanoseconds time to a time in the host clock's time base.
static long getCurrentHostTime()
          Retrieve the current host time value.
static double getHostClockFrequency()
          Retrieve the number of ticks per second of the host clock.
static int getHostClockMinimumTimeDelta()
          Retrieve the smallest number of ticks difference between two succeeding values of the host clock.

Method Detail

getCurrentHostTime

public static long getCurrentHostTime()
Retrieve the current host time value.

getHostClockFrequency

public static double getHostClockFrequency()
Retrieve the number of ticks per second of the host clock.

getHostClockMinimumTimeDelta

public static int getHostClockMinimumTimeDelta()
Retrieve the smallest number of ticks difference between two succeeding values of the host clock. For instance, if this value is 5 and the first value of the host clock is X then the next time after X will be at greater than or equal X+5.

convertHostTimeToNanos

public static long convertHostTimeToNanos(long inHostTime)
Convert the given host time to a time in Nanoseconds.

convertNanosToHostTime

Convert the given Nanoseconds time to a time in the host clock's time base.
